meanings.definition: A surprising or unexpected problem or obstacle.
meanings.sent1: The project was going smoothly until we encountered some unexpected gotchas.
meanings.sent2: Be careful when buying a used car, there may be hidden gotchas you're not aware of.
meanings.sent3: The team faced a gotchas when the power went out during their presentation.
meanings.sent4: Life is full of unexpected gotchas that keep us on our toes.
meanings.sent5: She always carries a flashlight in her bag, ready for any gotchas along the way.

meanings.definition: A trick or trap designed to catch someone out.
meanings.sent1: The escape room was full of clever gotchas that stumped the participants.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist set up several gotchas to deceive unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: The magician's performance was filled with surprising gotchas that amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The treasure hunt had many hidden gotchas waiting to challenge the players.
meanings.sent5: The spy had to navigate through a maze of tricky gotchas to reach the secret documents.

meanings.definition: An instance of catching or seizing someone.
meanings.sent1: The gotchas of the suspect by the police was captured on camera.
meanings.sent2: The catcher's swift gotchas of the ball saved the game for his team.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful gotchas of the toy mouse entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: The spider's web was full of successful gotchas of unsuspecting insects.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman's precise gotchas of the fish impressed his fellow anglers.
